let's move on to network configuration
for our notebook instance
when determining what network we want to
use we start with one basic option
vpc or no vpc a vpc
or virtual private cloud allows a user
to provision off a section of the cloud
that is logically isolated
this means an area of the cloud that
would be cut off from the broader cloud
environment
accessible only through very specific
and secure private networks
we as users have the option to choose
between three main configuration types
no vpc which is default setting
a vpc attached with internet access
and a vpc attached without internet
access
all of these configuration options will
configure a network interface
on the managed ec2 instance on which
your sagemaker notebook is running
let's walk through each of these options
in a bit more detail
first if we choose not to attach a vpc
to our notebook instance
all network traffic will flow through a
single network interface that is managed
by sagemaker
this allows our notebook instance to
have direct access to the internet
thus allowing us to download popular
packages or notebooks or further
customize our development environment to
enable efficient and effective work
so why wouldn't we want to just let our
notebook connect directly to the
internet
the answer is security by allowing your
notebook access to the broader internet
you expose the notebook to threats via
both code or malicious users
say you download a package you believe

science development process
but in actuality there's malicious code
that wants to access your data

are now exposed to this malicious code
if we do not want to manage additional

subnet and security group let's first
talk about subnets
first what is a subnet a subnet is a
specified cidr block
within your vpc and more importantly a
subnet resides entirely within one
availability zone which is different
from the broader
bpc resource which spans multiple
availability zones
if a selected subnet has traffic that is
routed to an internet gateway
we refer to that as a public subnet
if we create a subnet that does not have
access to the internet we refer to that
as a private subnet here we will be
using a public subnet
so that we can pull down public
repositories and packages
as we would like the last thing we need
to decide on is our security group
security groups are essentially a
virtual firewall that can control
incoming and outgoing
when we specify a subnet and security
group we allow sagemaker to create

that are associated with our subnet enis
allow our model containers to connect to
